item.title: PUZZLE 1 : Part 3/3 : DISCUSSION : Patterns in ARC-AGI
item.description: This puzzle was taken from the ARC-AGI dataset & includes tests that we would expect an AGI to be able to solve easily. Recognising patterns means finding things that repeat or look similar in a group of things, like spotting shapes in the clouds or finding the same picture in a puzzle. It’s hard for computers because they need to understand the context, deal with messy or missing information, and learn from just a few examples.
